column4: Greetings peeps. I'm having some trouble installing the ra2860 driver on my MSI Wind U-100. I've compiled it, but when i try the command: cp RT2860STA.dat /etc/Wireless/RT2860STA/RT2860STA.dat , I get the reply: cp: cannot create regular file `/etc/Wireless/RT2860STA/RT2860STA.dat': No such file or directory
most likely because the /etc/Wireless/RT2860STA/ does not exist.
It won't let me make the folder
you'll need to borrow root permissions (since /etc/ is a "global system affecting" folder) use terminal and do "sudo mkdir /etc/Wireless/RT2860STA/"
you'll also have to use sudo when copying the .dat file into there.
mkdir: cannot create directory `/etc/Wireless/RT2860STA/': No such file or directory
^ what legend2440 said, seems like the /etc/Wireless folder doesn't exist either, so you'll have to create it as well.
are you sure the source from where you are copying the RT2860STA.dat file were correct?
I wasn't in the right directory :P Dog
and/or legend2440: insmod: error inserting 'rt2860sta.ko': -1 File exists
then use rmmod to remove the old module first
It says module is in use
and/or legend2440: FATAL: Module rt2860sta.ko not found.
use lsmod to find the module name. It will not have a .ko ending.
